availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: I certify that I presided over a writ of John Marshall against Johnane Marshall for her good behavior in pendleton county in the year 1863 for which the proof in case did not amount to any thing serious though the Judgment was for the defendant to appear at the next circuit court held in Said cty, for which he gave bond in the Sum of $250,00 with P S Ransom W, G, Wilson & P. Louis Security.
as I am informed the defendant was a way from home at the time of trial and the Securities lost Sight of the case and failed to attend to it

and Judgment was rendered on the bond, it appears that the defendant lost Sight of the time of trial and the Securities also lost sight of the case Supposing it was all settled, as the plantif was the fatherinlaw of deft and I have heard no complaint of the defendants behavior Sinse that time given this 3rd day of Aprl 1865
Wm A Brann J p p C
